subject: Personal Finance
title: Price Controls Don't Work
description: A quick, practical guide to Price Controls Don't Work.

hook.text: Emperor Diocletian set maximum prices in 301 AD. Merchants stopped selling. Shelves went empty.

buildup.text: Price controls cap how much sellers can charge. They sound simple and fair.

discovery.text: When prices are capped below market value, sellers produce less or sell on the black market.

twist.text: Nixon tried price controls in 1971. Shortages appeared. When controls lifted, prices surged higher.

climax.text: Two thousand years of evidence shows the same result: price controls create shortages.

punchline.text: Cap the price, empty the shelves.

quiz.question: What typically happens when governments impose price controls?
options: Shortages appear as producers reduce supply
